metadata.title: Oceanographic Structure in the Bering Sea

creators.name: Hokkaido University, Laboratory of Physical Oceanography, Faculty of Fisheries

metadata.description: To explain the mechanism of formation for various structural types of the shelf waters or the process of transformation from the Pacific waters to the new Bering Sea waters, showing the oceanographic structures of the sea, and to make a summary of the characteristics and a role of the Bering Sea in the Subarctic Circulation, those having influence on marine life as a physical environment.
metadata.notes:
Purpose: To explain the mechanism of formation for various structural types of the shelf waters or the process of transformation from the Pacific waters to the new Bering Sea waters, showing the oceanographic structures of the sea, and to make a summary of the characteristics and a role of the Bering Sea in the Subarctic Circulation, those having influence on marine life as a physical environment.
